result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenny R Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact direct or indirect with JS except as allowed by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 20 hours of unpaid community service for non-profit agency under direction of Dept. of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenny R Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for 1 year to pay Court-ordered financial obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenny R Richardson in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. State advises of settlement offer. Defendant wants to accept offer. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State makes sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
No contact direct or indirect with J.S. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Kenny R Richardson in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
